sentences.sContent: God warns us never to get cocky and overconfident; that is the recipe for disaster.
sentences.sContent_eng: God warns us never to get cocky and overconfident; that is the recipe for disaster.
sentences.sCn: 神警告我们绝不可自高过于自信，那是招致灾难的处方。

sentences.sContent: Islamists should be careful not to fall into the trap of feeling overconfident: they must accommodate other trends, even if it means making painful concessions.
sentences.sContent_eng: Islamists should be careful not to fall into the trap of feeling overconfident: they must accommodate other trends, even if it means making painful concessions.
sentences.sCn: 伊斯兰教徒要小心地避开可能陷入的自负的陷阱：他们必须适应潮流，即使这意味着他们必须做出痛苦的让步。

sentences.sContent: I will always remember Brittany as that loud, overconfident girl, and a part of that shy, insecure person I used to be will always keep me humble.
sentences.sContent_eng: I will always remember Brittany as that loud, overconfident girl, and a part of that shy, insecure person I used to be will always keep me humble.
sentences.sCn: 我会一直记住布里塔尼，那个举止招摇而又张狂自负的女孩。 而曾经腼腆而又不自信的我也会一如既往地保持那份谦卑。

words.tran: 煮得太久的；做得过分的
把…煮得过久；过于劳累；把…做得过度（overdo的过去分词）
把…做得过分；使过于疲劳；对…表演过火；夸张

trans.tranCn: 自负的, 过于自信的
